definitions.definition: Someone who or something that trails.
Part of an object which extends some distance beyond the main body of the object.
An unpowered wheeled vehicle, not a caravan or camper, that is towed behind another, and used to carry equipment, etc, that cannot be carried in the leading vehicle.
definitions.example: At the end of the day, we put the snowmobiles back on the trailer.

definitions.definition: A furnished vehicle towed behind another, and used as a dwelling when stationary; a caravan; a camper.
definitions.example: We drove our trailer to Yellowstone Park.

definitions.definition: A prefabricated home that could be towed to a new destination but is typically permanently left in an area designated for such homes.
definitions.example: The young couple′s first home was in a trailer.

definitions.definition: A preview of a film, video game or TV show.
definitions.example: The trailer for that movie makes it seem like it would be fun.

definitions.definition: A short blank segment of film at the end of a reel, for convenient insertion of the film in a projector.

The final record of a list of data items, often identified by a key field with an otherwise invalid value that sorts last alphabetically (e.g., “ZZZZZ”) or numerically (“99999”); especially common in the context of punched cards, where the final card is called a trailer card.
definitions.example: The linked list terminates with a trailer record.

definitions.definition: The last part of a packet, often containing a check sequence.
definitions.example: The encapsulation layer adds an eight-byte header and a two-byte trailer to each packet.

definitions.definition: To load on a trailer or to transport by trailer.
definitions.example: The engine wouldn't run any more so we had to trailer my old car to the wrecking yard.
